metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1586 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A malicious webview could install long-lived unload handlers that re-use an incognito BrowserContext that is queued for destruction in versions of Oxide before 1.18.3.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1586` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.18.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.18.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.18.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqmlscene - 1.18.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.18.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.18.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.18.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: oxide-qt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.18.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
